content.description:
This is one of the top three 5.11 trad climbs at the City.  The name is very fitting.  The crux is protected by a #2 Lowe ball.  Gear larger than 1/4 inch is not had until way after the crux.

Start by face climbing past a bolt. (Stick clip?)  Fire in some small bomber nuts, and stand up on the small ledge.  Place you #2 ballnut which can be backed up with a #2 RP a little lower.  A #.2 Camalot can be placed right after the crux lieback moves.  Thin pro, tough placements, and pumpy moves lead to a rest ledge.  Mid 5.10 moves lead through a finger crack and small roof.  Rap 90ft from a 2 bolt anchor.

Try not too have too much terror in tiny town.
content.protection: Tiny to .5 inch for the first half, large nuts and a #2 Camalot for the final section

content.description: On the north side of Buzzards Perch, scramble up blocky ledges until you reach a face that is littered with holds. Pick a line. Left is definitely a bit more spicy than right, but right is probably more exposed.  The summit rewards the adventurous with an unparalleled view of the entire City.
content.protection: This is a good solo route that is easy to downclimb. Not sure what kind of pro you would take if you want to rope up. Maybe just a handful of slings for horns and a few cams to make an anchor. No rappel anchors seen, so be prepared to build one if you haul up a rope.

content.description: An obvious line left waiting in plain sight. The route climbs the seam left of Fat Lip. Fun steep laybacking leads to a changing corner crux with delicate feet and insecure locks. Just when you think it's over there is one more surprise in store!
content.protection: Mixed gear and bolts. Micro cams up to #3 and  5 draws should get you to the chains
content.location: Start the same as Fat Lip, continue straight up into the giant corner to the roof.

climbs.name: Ghetto Blaster AKA Straight out of the Ghetto
climbs.fa: Original line-Stan Caldwell and Dan Sperlock '86 Direct start-Ian Cavanaugh 9/27/13

content.description: This route can easily be seen from the parking lot at Parking Lot Rock.  It is to the right of Terror in Tiny Town.  The original line starts high on a block and traverses in on a crack from the right.  The direct start begins at the belay stance and goes directly straight up into Ghetto Blaster.  The direct start add about 40 feet of climbing through technical balancy terrain with sparse protection.  In total this route, done direct, comprises of basically 4 boulder problems with a good rest in the middle.  After you get through the final bugle crux you are rewarded with 50 more feet of .10- hand crack as a treat.  Descend off the north end of the rock via a 5.2 down climb
content.protection: a double rack, micro cams to #3 BD, 1 draw
content.location: This route can be seen from Parking Lot Rock parking lot.  splitter crack that cuts Buzzards perch in half.

content.description: This route is located 20 feet to the left of Terror of Tiny Town.  It is the bolted line that leads up and through a roof.  It begins with a thin seam crack which deposits you on to a small ledge.  Traverse the catwalk to the right for 10 feet clipping 2 bolts along the way to a small left facing dihedral with bolts on the outside.  Cruise up the corner and head slightly right through some big flakes.  As the flake peters out edge right and find stances in the folds of granite.  from under the roof clip the bolt at the lip and get ready to pull extremely HARD up and over onto exciting holds to the chains.  Wow!
content.protection: All bolts.  Possibly small nuts and tcu's for the beginning and between bolts 5 and 6 if you are not feeling up to it.

content.description:
This offering provides cool but short pseudo-arête climbing, well worth doing as either a warm up or cool down for the nearby ultra-classic

Terror of Tiny Town

.  Tricky but well protected.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chains.  The first bolt looks like its a ways up, but the climbing is easy and if at all worried, a hand-size cam will take care of it (hidden crack just inside the squeeze chimney).
content.location:
Furthest left bolted line on the West Face of the Buzzard's Perch, about 100 feet left of

Terror of Tiny Town

and 50 feet left of

Wafer of Woe

(not in MP, yet).  Look for bolts up a blunt arête right of a large flake system that starts out as a squeeze chimney.
